Text:
14. Dalit. Girl. Missing since 4 PM. 
 Kerosene doused. Ablaze.  
 Bright student. Fading star. 
 Receding from public memory. 
 Dead!

When does a headline cease to become a cold, distant fact?  
 When do the story’s flames leap up and engulf you too?

They say she lit a fire for herself 
 After writing a meticulous, tiny note.  
 Hinting at a soul piercing lament. 
 But just about; she died unheard.

RIP Student of Government Higher Secondary School Irimbiliyam 
 As the adults around you rinse and repeat 
 “Devika your TV set could not be repaired” 
 “Your father lost his job as an agricultural hand” 
 “They didn’t own a mobile or tablet

Your parents Sheeba and Balakrishan embrace each other wordless 
 As journalists join your wake and chastise failed virtual experiments 
 Activists write petitions for reliable internet connections

“Do-gooders please donate funds, old phones, and computers 
 321 million students must attend class
DO: Take a walk, make note of what’s not OK. Don’t fret; fix it.
